post.body: Getting drenched is a very liberating feeling. The office air conditioning makes one sick later, but who cares! :)
We are all like Bolivar and he, like us. A spectacular mix of the general and the servant. I resisted your generalization ...
there is no such thing as an ordinary citizen. A similar reduction could apply to anything. Don't start with presumptions.
This is good! No one finds anything without first getting lost. Now try Simon Bolivar...
Morning!
those are parts that don't change. Okay, I will... be... ummm... Bolivar.
Which one of me?
Glad you could relate to it Shevonne. Yes.
:) priceless kishore kumar, speaking of which, here's another http://bit.ly/heAV
:) perhaps in a parallel universe... this one has no answers at all.
We teach best, what we most need to learn.
12-24 hour? o_O I thought you were a doctor, that sounds like the schedule of a ski resort owner!
Green.
Forget the quality, They hardly ever have movies i want to rent. Cancelled mine after the first three months.
:) Still in office, but you helped set the mood for the evening just right.
.. and the other says "You tend to be shy and withdrawn." Couldn't present a more torn picture. But hey, Imperial March+MainTheme=WIN!
Uh Oh. That link showed me Strawberry, but Chocolate FTW! Yeah, one says "You offer people a dark side that is very hard to resist."..
Here's a punch: "Mom: You've been hitting rocks in the house??? WHY WOULD YOU DO THAT??? Calvin: Poor Genetic Material?"
you're a strawberry cake! *nom*. I am a Lemon Cake. What it says about these conclusions is funnier; I seem to be Darth Skywalker. LOL
Do they have a coffee quiz? But, I know before taking one... I'd be a Columbian Bean!
A Blueberry Muffin and A Mud Pie.
:) Delicious. Made me miss home.
Twitter as a tool for information discovery? Same as every other social network: It Depends on who you follow.
@_Num Pants were made for men, not women; women were made for men, not pants. That said, women in formal=WIN but Sarees=WIN++
One of my favourites; it's a song called silent all these years by Tori Amos. Give it a try, you may like it too.
...our capacity to interpret them, the experiences to be able to associate with them and our frame of mind at a point of time.
You are taking me back to 6th grade. :) And yes, Tilak Kamod is very beautiful, but then so are the rest. It all rests on...
Bless your soul! If it were the olden times, I'd have ripped off a pearl necklace for you. :)
Of Course! And KishorI Amonkar's expression of it is priceless. Arrey Bhopali! Is sey yaad aaya: Ab ke Hum bichchde: Mehdi Saab.
I would say, take your life as it comes. And think of your education as an enabler, It is just a step, not a destination.
Jaffa is an amazing place that reeks of history. Love the street food and the alleys. Ilana Goor's museum and Nir Zook's res ...
I Second that. Good Earth Muesli is amongst the best in the Indian market. It was owned by Waheeda Rehman once, I reckon.
Absolutely. It is nothing but a lame attempt to save themselves. Our thoughts are echoed by sane journalists too: http://bit.ly/FA1k
I didn't quite feel she addressed anything directly. Her line of argument is: no one said so. I don't really agree with it. Do you?
"I am the lizard king!" :P
a syllogism I once heard from Javed Jaffrey... :) but I think you got the point; nothing quite like a saree.
A good morning to you Dr. Mohanty! What's new?
No, I like it.
I hate being the voice of reason :) yeah you are right, that is uber-expensive. Did you check Samsung 24" LCD widescreens?
weren't you a Macintosh user? Apple LED/Cinema Displays FTW!
both and neither :)
Do check for their documentary on the construction of a katana. The science behind the weapon is awe inspiring; A magnificient art!
Have fun FabooMama!
There is probably nothing I can say to ease the shock.... Terribly Sorry about it Polly. <Hugs>
<HUGS> Polly.
Nice Show Gary! Enjoyed it thoroughly. Amazing energy.
Ha Ha! That's the spirit my friend! But then why is the party an alibi? Call her up... :)
Ah! The intolerable cruelty of providence. No matter how hard we work, Murphy works harder, eh?
Didn't quite get the simile... Isn't observation the only way by which modern medicine works? We don't fully understand human body.

Because it is a Warner Brothers production.
Long Time No See! How have you been?
LMAO. I think It would be option 3 by the way. :)
Achcha? I will most certainly find her music and sample it. I am sure she should be great, considering her father's caliber.

I was 10 then :) I love Good Food.Eat everything that grows on earth, walks on it or flies (and is smaller than me). And I <3 Milk.
:) My mom only had to turn on the the TV - there could be anything on it; I was a sucker thereafter. Even for Peas and Spinach.
Sounds great. What Plans for Christmas?

underutilized too. He needs a strong director to deliver a performance that is not a recycled version of his own work.
Read your post. I still don't think Tangible media will ever end. I hope not at least. Voted.
The law infrastructure in India is utterly outdated and lawsuits based on these issues would be very tricky in Indian Judiciaries.

w00t! I am sure of the 'wild' and the 'crazy' if The Quark was involved. :)
Morning Nick! Oh absolutely, its on its way. What would you go with this morning? Cereal or Eggs? I am thinking eggs...?

The simplest questions in life are the toughest to answer. But once we do find them, the simplicity of our own answers often surprises us.
When the future's architectured, by a carnival of idiots on show, you better lie low...
... Everybody is making love, Or else expecting rain, And the good samaritan, he's dressing, he's getting ready for the show ...
12:55. Time for the alter ego to take over...

नसीब होगी बर्हर कैफ, मर्जी-ऐ-साकी; मिले जो ज़हर भी तो यारों मुस्कुरा के पियो... यह किसने कह दिया आख़िर के छुप छुपा के पियो...

Headache, Loads of work, plentiful ignorance around... Lord, this is SO not the Friday I was looking forward to.

Let my epitaph read - the man who wanted to know everything.
BBC: Leonardo Da Vinci
His gait betrayed his fatigue but his deep brown eyes were still full of life, like a man who had been walking so long he forget tiring.

Back after a more than average dose of Vitamin D. Now need to get workin.
Aye zindagi, gale laga le; humne bhi, tere har ek gam ko, gale se lagaaya hai, hai na?
Feeling rejuvenated after a good run and praanayam. Now to plan the day carefully, a lot to be done.
Going for a run.
internet outage. :( we've come to a time when this becomes as serious a handicap as a power outage. i'll call it a day. g'night all!

There is only one way to understand the implications of the title 'Ustad' - you need to see an Ustad in action.
is ecstatic. Nothing quite like musical geniuses for company for a Saturday evening; And brilliant South Indian food with friends to end it.
Looking forward to an evening immersed in great music: Ustad Zakir Hussain, Selvaganesh and U Shrinivas in concert. Can hardly contain it :)
Hello? Is there anybody in there? Just nod if you can hear me... Is there anyone home? ... there's an eerie silence on my twitter stream! :/
Watching Mysteries of Asia; Jewels of the Jungle to get over the Da Vinci Documentary.
checking my brother's 12th grade project in chemistry. Bibliography has google at the top. :)

is Like a dog without a bone, an actor out on loan...

Cerebellum: Fried. Recuperation: On. Mode: Guitar.
Dil Kabaddi: 2/5. Irrfan Khan makes the movie watchable. Could've been better if they hadn't completely ripped off Husbands and Wives.
Off to watch Dil Kabaddi. Laters!
Where is my Mojo???
A pool of people, some trying to find something by drowning in an ocean of noise, some trying to get lost in the ocean themselves.
I think I need to outsource my cellphone. I need a primary line of defence against unsolicited phone calls and messages.
Planning the next three weekends. Three weekends to 2008 folks...
My Sennheiser cans died on me :(
Shalom! Boker Tov! A Brilliant Morning to Everyone!
...Love, Love, Love; Well, that's just like hypnotizing chickens! Well, I'm just a modern guy... And I've a lust for life...
is feeling like a freak on a leash.
OD-ed last night on music. It was the sweetest death by the Masterful Brilliance of Pt. ShivKumar Sharma and Pt. Ajoy Chakraborty. <Sigh>
Off to the Sawai Gandharva Festival... Pt. ShivKumar Sharma FTW! See ya Later folks!
I hurt easy, I just don't show it, you can hurt someone and not even know it, the next sixty seconds can feel like an eternity...
And the thing that freaks me out, Is I'll always be in doubt... It's the animal, the animal, the animal instinct in me...
Mine is not a heart of stone, I am only skin and bones, those little pieces are little pieces of my own... why don't you give me some love?
can hardly wait for the evening. Can't it be 5 already?!
Back from a most refreshing jog on a dewey winter morning. Crunches, Hot Shower, Sunny Side up to follow.
Okay, time for a morning jog. And a very Good Morning to Everyone who is up and about.
signing off for the day. Need to ponder on some essays and then sleep. G'Night Everyone.

is having a 'Crisis Friday'.
Stupendous Man gets ready for another night out to work. But what about his arch nemesis Monday? Will caffeine be able to help him tomorrow?
Was watching Mr. India at a friend's place. Now I have the song stuck in my head. "Kaate Nahi Kat te".
Tomato Makhani Soup on its way. And with that, I am once again getting back to work.
This was my second and last visit to 'More'. I'm never going there for anything. Rotten Vegetables, Very limited range, Bad Customer care.
Was at a greeting card store. There was one row each for Father and Mother Birthday cards; four for Lovers. It's a Sad society we live in.
Just how far are we from a Centralized National Identification system? It will make tracking of the nationals far easier, improve security.
Just got a circular from the society. Apparently the state police has requested Societies to mandate IDs for all residents. I'm confused.
